DataElement.preferredName: Performance Status Assessment Karnofsky And Lansky Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value related to the karnofsky and lansky performance assessment score.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of  how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Compound object class with addition of assessment property. 02/22/2013 - tc - Removed retired concept C25367 and replaced with C25217.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Karnofsky And Lansky Performance Status Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A standard way of measuring the ability of cancer patients to perform ordinary tasks.  The scores range from 0 to 100, with a higher score indicating a better ability to carry out daily activities.  KPS may be used to determine a patient's prognosis, to measure changes in functioning, or to decide if a patient could be included in a clinical trial._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The play-performance scale for children is a parent-rated instrument which records usual play activity as the index of performance.  It is similar to the Karnofsky Performance Scale for adults._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Karnofsky scale - Dead;      Lansky scale - unresponsive

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Karnofsky scale - Dead; Lansky scale - unresponsive

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Karnofsky scale - Moribund, fatal process progressing rapidly;  Lansky scale - Completely disabled, not even passive play.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Karnofsky scale - Moribund, fatal process progressing rapidly; 
Lansky scale - Completely disabled, not even passive play.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Karnofsky scale - Normal, no complaints, no evidence of disease;   Lansky scale - Fully active.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Karnofsky scale - Normal, no complaints, no evidence of disease;  
Lansky scale - Fully active.

Karnofsky scale - Very sick, hospitalization necessary;

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Karnofsky scale - Severely disabled, hospitalization indicated, although death not imminent. Lansky scale - Needs considerable assistance for quiet activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Karnofsky scale - Severely disabled, hospitalization indicated, although death not imminent.
Lansky scale - Needs considerable assistance for quiet activity.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Karnofsky scale - Disabled, requires special care and assistance. Lansky scale - Able to initiate quiet activities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Karnofsky scale - Disabled, requires special care and assistance.
Lansky scale - Able to initiate quiet activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Karnofsky scale - Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care; Lansky scale - Considerable assistance required for any active play; fully able to engage in quiet play.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Karnofsky scale - Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care; Lansky scale - Considerable assistance required for any active play; fully able to engage in quiet play.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Karnofsky scale - Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care;
Lansky scale - Considerable assistance required for any active play; fully able to engage in quiet play.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Karnofsky scale - Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work.; Lansky score - Both greater restrictions of, and less time spent in, active play.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Karnofsky scale - Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work.; Lansky score - Both greater restrictions of, and less time spent in, active play.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Karnofsky scale - Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work.;
Lansky score - Both greater restrictions of, and less time spent in, active play.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Karnofsky scale - Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most needs; Lansky scale - Ambulatory up to 50R of time, limited active play with assistance / supervision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:

Lansky scale - Ambulatory up to 50R of time, limited active play with assistance / supervision.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Karnofsky scale - Normal activity with effort; Lansky scale - Restricted in strenuous play, tires more easily, otherwise active.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:

Lansky scale - Restricted in strenuous play, tires more easily, otherwise active.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Karnofsky Performance Status And Lansky Play-Performance Status Score
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Karnofsky Performance Status. A standard way of measuring the ability of cancer patients to perform ordinary tasks.  The scores range from 0 to 100, with a higher score indicating a better ability to carry out daily activities.  KPS may be used to determine a patient's prognosis, to measure changes in functioning, or to decide if a patient could be included in a clinical trial.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The play-performance scale for children is a parent-rated instrument which records usual play activity as the index of performance.  It is similar to the Karnofsky Permormance Scale for adults.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An index designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The play-performance scale for children is a parent-rated instrument which records usual play activity as the index of performance.  It is similar to the Karnofsky Performance Scale for adults.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
